content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is a simple solution to your problem using Julia's built-in functions.

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter(w -> isuppercase(first(w)), words)
end
```
This function uses the `filter` function provided by Julia, which creates a new collection containing only elements that satisfy the condition specified in the function. In this case, we use an anonymous function (which defines a function on-the-fly) to filter out words that don't start with a capital letter using the `isuppercase` function and `first` function to get first character of the string. 

Here is how you can call it:
```julia
words = ["Dog", "dog", "Cat", "cat"]
print(keep_only_names(words)) # This will print ["Dog", "Cat"]
```
